body_html:
The warnings about sse4.2 or AVX are completely benign, and can be ignored. It just means that TensorFlow can run faster on your machine if you build from sources. But everything will run OK on your machine, you can safely ignore these warnings.

From what I can see, You did not actually clone the code, but you tried to build our sources.
Especially the first bazel command you have above does not do anything at all (no build target specified).
Unless you clone our github repo, run configure, build the code, then build the pip package and install the resulting pip package, bazel commands themselves will not have any effect. For that, you need to follow our the instructions here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources

I will close this issue, as the user clearly did not follow the instructions to build from sources.
Please create a new issue if you run into issues with the instructions to install from sources.

body:
The warnings about sse4.2 or AVX are completely benign, and can be ignored. It just means that TensorFlow can run faster on your machine if you build from sources. But everything will run OK on your machine, you can safely ignore these warnings.

From what I can see, You did not actually clone the code, but you tried to build our sources.
Especially the first bazel command you have above does not do anything at all (no build target specified).
Unless you clone our github repo, run configure, build the code, then build the pip package and install the resulting pip package, bazel commands themselves will not have any effect. For that, you need to follow  our the instructions here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources

I will close this issue, as the user clearly did not follow the instructions to build from sources.
Please create a new issue if you run into issues with the instructions to install from sources.
